skill.name: blog-writer
skill.description: Write and add new blog posts for this Next.js site by matching the existing BlogPost structure in `src/lib/blog-data.ts`. Use when asked to draft a new blog article, update blog content, or produce SEO metadata/slug/image details for a new post.
skill.summary: Write and format blog posts for Next.js sites with SEO optimization and consistent metadata structure
skill.author: Eccentric-jamaican

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains no actual external command execution, network requests, or cryptographic operations. The detected patterns are markdown code formatting (backticks) and benign documentation text that triggered overly broad security signatures.

content.value_statement: Writing blog content requires consistent formatting, SEO metadata, and adherence to site structure. This skill streamlines blog post creation for Next.js sites by following established patterns and generating complete, publication-ready entries.
actual_capabilities: Create new blog posts matching the BlogPost TypeScript interface structure
Generate SEO metadata including title, description, and keywords
Format content using markdown with consistent section patterns
Validate slug uniqueness and ISO date format compliance
limitations: Designed for Next.js sites with a specific BlogPost structure
Does not publish posts to external platforms or CMS
Does not generate images or multimedia content
Requires existing blog-data.ts file to follow its patterns

use_cases.title: Content Team Workflow
use_cases.description: Quickly draft new blog articles with proper formatting, SEO fields, and consistent tone for Next.js blogs.

use_cases.title: Developer Documentation
use_cases.description: Add technical blog posts that follow project conventions without manual formatting or structure research.

use_cases.title: SEO Optimization
use_cases.description: Generate blog content with properly formatted metadata for search engine visibility.

prompt_templates.title: New Blog Post
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a new blog post about {topic} for our Next.js blog. Use the blog-writer skill to create a complete BlogPost entry that matches our existing structure in src/lib/blog-data.ts. Include SEO title, description, keywords, and follow the patterns in references/blog-patterns.md.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a complete blog post from scratch

prompt_templates.title: Update Existing Post
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the blog post with slug {slug}. Improve the content, update the date if needed, and ensure all SEO fields are optimized. Use the blog-writer skill to maintain consistency with our BlogPost structure.
prompt_templates.scenario: Revising and improving existing blog content

prompt_templates.title: Draft with Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a blog post using the blog-writer skill. Requirements: Category should be {category}, target keyword is {keyword}, and the post should address {main_point}. Follow our standard structure and include a sources section if citing data.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Content
prompt_templates.prompt: Create {count} blog post drafts about {topics}. Each should follow our blog-writer patterns, have unique slugs, proper SEO metadata, and be ready for review. Store them as new BlogPost entries.
prompt_templates.scenario: Generating multiple blog post drafts efficiently

best_practices: Review existing blog posts before creating new ones to maintain consistent tone and structure
Always validate that slugs are unique and dates follow ISO YYYY-MM-DD format
Include relevant keywords in SEO fields while keeping content natural and readable
anti_patterns: Creating posts without referencing the existing BlogPost structure
Skipping the SEO metadata validation step
Using inconsistent categories or author names across posts

faq.question: What file structure does this skill expect?
faq.answer: The skill expects a Next.js project with a BlogPost interface defined in src/lib/blog-data.ts containing fields for slug, title, excerpt, content, date, readTime, category, author, image, and seo metadata.

faq.question: Does this skill publish to external platforms?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates blog post content and metadata locally. It does not connect to WordPress, Medium, or other publishing platforms.

faq.question: Can I use this for any type of website?
faq.answer: This skill is designed specifically for Next.js sites following the BlogPost pattern. It may not work correctly for sites with different content structures or frameworks.

faq.question: How does the skill handle SEO optimization?
faq.answer: The skill generates SEO title, description, and keywords based on the post content. It follows patterns from references/blog-patterns.md and includes Jamaica-relevant terms when appropriate.

faq.question: What if I need to add images?
faq.answer: The skill references images as /blog/filename.png in the public/blog directory. You must manually place image files in that location before or after generating the post.

faq.question: Can this skill update existing blog posts?
faq.answer: Yes. Provide the existing slug and the skill will update the matching BlogPost entry while maintaining the required structure and adding any new metadata fields.
